column3: ACK on concept. It is very important to flush immediately on a keypool update, but less so when adding a transaction (as this can be corrected) and then especially en-masse during a rescan.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4805_04dbecac9dcc1cc0b8ff450d48104bc09f32d3ab/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

concept ACK.  Makes me dislike our RAII CDB method of I/O for the wallet even more ;p  Pondering an alternate way of accomplishing the same thing.

Gave this an "it works" tests.
The best "alternate solution" would be to get rid of berkeleydb completely (eg #5686).\n
Maybe make fFlushOnClose a constructor argument?\n
I don't like this duplication. Would it be very invasive to require every client of this function to pass a valid CWalletDB*?\n
